name: cs.edu
tagline: GNU/Linux distro providing tools needed by computer science students.
body:
### A toolbox distro for young developers

cs.edu is a reboot of programming-oriented distros, providing either a full-fledged debian-based, 
debian-compatible distro, or a set of scripts to install most of the programming 
tools computer science students need.

### What is it ?

cs.edu is still alpha software. It brings users two things: a set of scripts/lists of interesting software ; an iso, ready to install.

### History

Its name came from [cs.edu Slax](http://charybde.homeunix.org/~schmitz/slax-csedu/), a distro that stopped in 2007. A dire need for a ready-to program distribution to install on computers in the University of Nantes started the project.

### Authors and Contributors
2014, Pierre-Antoine Rault (@rigelk)
